intro.title: Welcome to BleuRoi Ragdoll Cattery
intro.paragraph1: BleuRoi Ragdoll Cattery is a licensed and registered Ragdoll breeder located in Bulgaria, specializing in breeding exceptional pedigree Ragdoll kittens. Every kitten comes with complete documentation including pedigree papers, European pet passport, two vaccinations, and microchip. We maintain the highest standards of health, socialization, and ethical breeding practices.
intro.paragraph2: Our breeding cats originate from prestigious European and Russian bloodlines. We offer Ragdoll kittens for various purposes: beloved family pets (neutered and intact), show-quality cats, and carefully selected breeding stock for licensed catteries. We proudly ship throughout Europe with no restrictions. Licensed by Bulgarian authorities (License 47090/2024) and registered with FIFe and WCF international cat federations. Our breeding cats are champions with excellent show evaluations.
intro.callout: Contact us for additional photos and detailed information about our available Ragdoll kittens

history.title: The Ragdoll Breed: A Brief History
history.paragraph1: The Ragdoll cat breed was developed in California, USA, during the 1960s by breeder Ann Baker. The breed is named for its characteristic tendency to go limp and relaxed when picked up, resembling a child's ragdoll toy. Ragdolls are known for their striking blue eyes, semi-long silky coat, and color-point patterns.
history.paragraph2: Ragdolls are among the largest domestic cat breeds, with males weighing 15-20 pounds and females 10-15 pounds. They are renowned for their gentle, affectionate, and docile temperament, making them ideal family companions. The breed was officially recognized by major cat registries in the 1960s-1970s and has since become one of the most popular cat breeds worldwide.
history.quote: Ragdolls are the gentle giants of the cat world - affectionate, intelligent, and wonderfully calm.

character.title: Exceptional Temperament
character.description: Ragdolls are renowned for their gentle, affectionate, and calm nature. They are highly social cats who form strong bonds with their families, follow their owners around the house, and enjoy being held and cuddled. Despite their large size, Ragdolls are docile and patient, making them excellent with children and other pets.

origin.title: Breed Origin & Development
origin.description: Developed in 1960s California by breeder Ann Baker, the Ragdoll breed was created through selective breeding emphasizing temperament and appearance. The breed combines stunning physical beauty with an exceptionally gentle personality. Today, Ragdolls are internationally recognized and cherished worldwide.

appearance.title: Stunning Physical Characteristics
appearance.description: Ragdolls are large, muscular cats with semi-long, silky coats that require minimal grooming. Their most distinctive feature is their piercing blue eyes and color-point pattern. The breed features a medium-length coat that is soft and rabbit-like in texture, with minimal shedding compared to other long-haired breeds.

colors.title: Beautiful Color Patterns
colors.description: Ragdolls come in three main patterns: Colorpoint (darker points on ears, face, legs, and tail), Mitted (white mittens on paws and chin), and Bicolor (white inverted V on face and white chest and legs). Available in seal, blue, chocolate, lilac, red, and cream color variations.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Ragdoll Kittens
faq.subtitle: Everything You Need to Know Before Buying a Ragdoll Kitten

items.question: How much does a Ragdoll kitten cost?
items.answer: The price of a pedigree Ragdoll kitten from BleuRoi Cattery varies depending on quality, pedigree, color pattern, and intended purpose (pet, breeding, or show quality). Pet-quality Ragdoll kittens typically range from €800-1,200, while show and breeding-quality kittens command premium prices. All our kittens come with complete documentation including pedigree papers, European pet passport, two vaccinations, microchip, and health certificate. Contact us directly for current pricing and available kittens.

items.question: Are your Ragdoll kittens TICA registered?
items.answer: Yes! BleuRoi Ragdoll Cattery is officially registered with TICA (The International Cat Association), FIFe (Fédération Internationale Féline), and WCF (World Cat Federation). All our Ragdoll kittens come with authentic pedigree papers from internationally recognized cat registries, ensuring their purebred status and champion bloodlines. We hold License 47090/2024 from Bulgarian authorities, confirming our commitment to ethical breeding standards.

items.question: What health guarantees do you provide with Ragdoll kittens?
items.answer: Every Ragdoll kitten from BleuRoi Cattery comes with comprehensive health documentation and guarantees. All kittens receive two vaccinations, microchipping, thorough veterinary health examinations, and a European pet passport before going to their new homes. Our breeding cats are tested for genetic diseases common to Ragdolls including HCM (hypertrophic cardiomyopathy) and PKD (polycystic kidney disease). We provide a written health guarantee and offer lifetime support to all our kitten families. Kittens leave our cattery at minimum 12-14 weeks of age, fully socialized and litter trained.

items.question: Do you ship Ragdoll kittens to other European countries?
items.answer: Yes, we ship Ragdoll kittens throughout Europe! BleuRoi Cattery arranges safe, professional pet transport services to most European countries. Your kitten will travel with complete documentation including EU pet passport, health certificates, and all required paperwork for international travel. We work with experienced pet transportation companies to ensure your kitten's comfort and safety during the journey. We can also arrange for you to pick up your kitten personally from our cattery in Bulgaria. Contact us to discuss shipping options and costs to your specific location.

items.question: What makes Ragdoll cats good family pets?
items.answer: Ragdoll cats are exceptional family companions known for their gentle, affectionate, and docile temperament. They are called 'Ragdolls' because they tend to go limp and relaxed when picked up. These beautiful blue-eyed cats are highly social, forming strong bonds with their families and getting along wonderfully with children and other pets. Ragdolls are intelligent, trainable, and generally quiet cats with soft, melodious voices. Unlike many cat breeds, Ragdolls typically enjoy being held and cuddled, making them perfect lap cats. Their calm nature and adaptable personality make them ideal for families, seniors, and first-time cat owners.

items.question: What color patterns do your Ragdoll kittens come in?
items.answer: BleuRoi Cattery breeds Ragdoll kittens in all three recognized patterns: Colorpoint (solid color points on ears, face, legs, and tail), Mitted (colorpoint with white mittens on paws and white chin), and Bicolor (white inverted 'V' on face with white chest, legs, and belly). Our kittens come in various beautiful colors including seal, blue, chocolate, lilac, red, and cream. All Ragdolls have striking blue eyes. Browse our available kittens page to see current colors and patterns, or contact us about upcoming litters if you're looking for a specific color combination.

items.question: How do I reserve a Ragdoll kitten from your cattery?
items.answer: Reserving a Ragdoll kitten from BleuRoi Cattery is simple! First, browse our 'Available Kittens' page or contact us about upcoming litters. Once you've selected a kitten, we'll discuss your family situation, experience with cats, and home environment to ensure a perfect match. A reservation deposit secures your chosen kitten. We maintain regular contact with updates, photos, and videos as your kitten grows. Kittens join their new families at 12-14 weeks of age, fully vaccinated, microchipped, and socialized. We provide comprehensive guidance on Ragdoll care, nutrition, and training. Contact us via phone (+359894 474 966), email (info@ragdollbleuroi.eu), or social media to begin the reservation process.

items.question: What is included when I buy a Ragdoll kitten from BleuRoi?
items.answer: Every Ragdoll kitten from BleuRoi Cattery comes with a complete package ensuring the best start in their new home: Authentic pedigree papers from FIFe/WCF registries showing champion bloodlines, European pet passport with full travel documentation, two core vaccinations (FVRCP), microchip implantation and registration, comprehensive veterinary health examination and certificate, deworming treatments, kitten starter kit including food samples, care instructions, and toy, lifetime breeder support and guidance, and a written health guarantee. We also provide detailed information about feeding, grooming, health care, and training your Ragdoll kitten.

items.question: What is the temperament of Ragdoll cats?
items.answer: Ragdoll cats are known as 'gentle giants' with exceptional temperament. They are extremely affectionate and loving, with a docile and calm demeanor. Ragdolls are patient with children, sociable with other pets, and intelligent enough to be easily trained. They have a low-maintenance personality and a characteristic tendency to go limp when held (hence 'Ragdoll'). These loyal cats often follow their owners around and are quieter than most cat breeds, making them ideal companions for any home environment.

items.question: At what age can Ragdoll kittens leave for their new homes?
items.answer: Ragdoll kittens from BleuRoi Cattery leave at 12-14 weeks of age minimum. This ensures kittens are fully weaned and eating independently, properly socialized with littermates, litter box trained, have received both core vaccinations, developed strong immune systems, and are ready for the transition to their new home. This extended time with their mother and siblings is crucial for developing proper social skills and confident, well-adjusted personalities.
